source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Chenopodiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Chenopodiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Plants decumbent (rarely shrubby), rooting at nodes; articles mostly more than 2 mm diam. between nodes; seeds with slender, often hooked hairs; coastal or inland habitats
Plants with tufted branches, arising directly from rootstock or from stolons; articles mostly less than 2 mm diam. between nodes, seeds with short acute hairs; rocky coasts
